dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4143 RH: National Construction Safety Team Enhancement Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Lofgren (for herself and Mr. Lucas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

Additional sponsors: Ms. Bonamici, Mr. Obernolte, Ms. Stevens, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Casten, Mr. Kean of New Jersey, Ms. Caraveo, Ms. Ross, Mr. Sorensen, Mr. Lieu, Mrs. Foushee, Mr. Bowman, Mr. Jackson of North Carolina, Mrs. Sykes, Ms. Lee of Pennsylvania, and Ms. Norton
Reported from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To amend the National Construction Safety Team Act to enable the National Institute of Standards and Technology to investigate structures other than buildings to inform the development of engineering standards, best practices, and building codes related to such structures, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Construction Safety Team Enhancement Act of 2023.
The National Construction Safety Team Act is amended—

clause.text: in the first sentence, by striking buildings and inserting structure; and

by inserting after the first sentence the following new sentence: In instances in which the failure of the building or structure is the proper subject for investigation by another Federal agency, the Director shall defer to the authority of such agency.;
in paragraph (1), by striking buildings and inserting the built environment; and

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting or structure after building;
in subparagraph (C), by striking building standards, codes, and practices and inserting engineering standards, practices, and building codes; and
in subparagraph (D), by striking buildings and inserting the built environment; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (G), by inserting or structure after building; and

subclause.text: by inserting or structure after building; and
by inserting or the National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004 after 1977;

subparagraph.text: by striking the term building each place it appears; and
by inserting building or structure before failure each place it appears;

paragraph.text: in section 7 (15 U.S.C. 7306), by inserting or structure after building;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting or structure after building;
in paragraph (3), by striking standards, codes, and practices and inserting engineering standards, practices, and building codes; and
in paragraph (4), by inserting and structure after building;

paragraph.text: in section 9(2) (15 U.S.C. 7308(2)), by striking building standards, codes, and practices each place it appears and inserting engineering standards, practices, and building codes;
in section 14 (15 U.S.C. 7312), by striking building standards, codes, or practices and inserting engineering standards, practices, and building codes; and
by amending section 15 (15 U.S.C. 7313) to read as follows:

section.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Director of the National Institute of Standards and Technology $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2027.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
